availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jesse B. Hickman (Harrison County, Ky, farmer)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Susannah Hickman. Father of James M. Hickman, William D. Hickman, Benjamin C. Hickman, John T. Hickman, Mary Hickman, Eliza Hickman, Henry B. Hickman, Robert N. Hickman, Martha Hickman, Amanda Hickman, and Nancy Hickman. Farmer in Harrison County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1850. Farmer in Harrison County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Harrison County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 1, p. 105A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, p. 615.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, Buena Vista, p. 100B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, p. 126A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 1, p. 361.
